result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Lewis Martin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Lewis Martin not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for David Lewis Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defendant is in custody at Winnebago and needs to provide the State with Chapter 51 documentation. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Lewis Martin not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sam Obscherning appeared by video for David Lewis Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Status Conference.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Defense requests adjournment.
Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant David Lewis Martin appeared by video.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for David Lewis Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.
For reasons set forth in the record defense requests additional time. State does not object.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant David Lewis Martin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sam Obscherning appeared by video for David Lewis Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.
Attorney Obscherning is unable to pass the Milwaukee County health protocol screening and requests additional time to review paperwork with defendant.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant David Lewis Martin in court with Attorney Sam Obscherning.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case heard in Branch 25 for Branch 30.  The case in court for Return on Doctor's Report.   Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties in receipt of examiner's report. State does not challenge Dr. Seipel report.  Defendant does challenge Dr. Seipel report.  State, defense and defendant waive right to hearing. Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Arguments heard as to bail.  The Court Order the bail remain and Defense requesting a Plea and Sentencing date.   Case adjourned to Branch 30.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Case spun to Judge Franke, Branch 25 due to judge unavailability.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court, defendant David Lewis Martin not in court, in custody.  Navjot Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Case remains calendared in Br. 30.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court, defendant David Lewis Martin not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 30 via Zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court, defendant David Lewis Martin not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel reqeusts status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant David Lewis Martin in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant David Lewis Martin in custody.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David Lewis Martin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
